page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: { ROSEWELL and CARRINGTON Nearly all of the grid squares that we studied were used for crop farming with the exception of the small rural village of Carrington and the larger town of Rosewell. Carrington, an attractive,tidy village, was voted Britain's best kept village three years in succession from 1977 to 1979. In complete contrast Rosewell is an ugly, run-down community where the principal employer- National Coal Board- has closed the mine and has allowed many of the houses to become empty and derelict. Rosewell was declared a conservation area recently to preserve the character of the 'mining company' village.
